alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:12PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Coffee and Geneva Counties in southeastern Alabama, southwestern Jackson, Gulf, Bay, western Calhoun, Walton, Holmes and Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 1245 AM EDT/1145 PM CDT/... At 1112 PM EDT/1012 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Niceville to 14 miles southeast of Santa Rosa Beach to 23 miles south of Panama City Beach to 39 miles southwest of Tyndall Air Force Base to 72 miles southwest of Port St. Joe. Movement was north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Elba, Vernon, Bonifay, Geneva, Santa Rosa Beach, De Funiak Springs, Chipley, Port St. Joe, Springfield, Samson, Mexico Beach, Hiland Park, Eglin Air Force Base, Tyndall Air Force Base, Bradford and Union. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
